Name: M B
Title: Beautiful temple
Review: The temple location is beautiful and the weather was so pleasant when I visited the temple, but the temple needs thorough maintenance.

Name: ccbtraveller
Title: money minded priests
Review: the temple is located in a very picturesque place, alone the beach.   the layout of different Lakshmi sanctums are kind of one above the other.  never seen such a temple architecture.the priest were just money minded.   they expect a  big tip & till they get it, they are pestering us.  very irritating behavior. due to that, lost the purpose of visit.

Name: SREENIVASAREDDY M
Title: May eight godesses ( Ashta lakshmi's) grace shower!
Review: As per Hindu mythology Ashtalkshmis are very famous for eight types of prosperity to a human being. They follow as below in a chronological orderAdi Lakshmi.= Overall wealthsDhana Lakshmi.= Money and jewellaryDhanya Lakshmi.= Food grainsGaja Lakshmi.= VehiclesSantana Lakshmi.= ChildrenVeera/Dhairya Lakshmi.= BraveryJaya/Vijaya Lakshmi.= VictoryVidya Lakshmi.= Knowledge and educationThis temple situated at sea shore in three floor building with separate sanctum sanctorums. Along with subject eight deity godesses, few more sub and main deity temples also established within the premises like Lord Ganesh, Lord Murugan etc.Every Hindu must visit religious place in Chennai, Tamilnadu, India

Name: anu_v
Title: Grand olden temple
Review: This is a very holy and an olden temple of the deity Mahalaksmi. This temple has a hidden pathway which leads to some of the oldest statues of Mahalaksmi. The statues of deities are still washed and clothed with silk sarees. Anyone who prays for wealth will be granted in this temple.  When we visited this temple it was at nite time 8pm lucky the volunteer running the temple helped us and told us to hurry to see the deepam lit up at the top altar of the temple.

Name: Sud D
Title: Lakshmi Temple
Review: This is beautifully laid out temple. It is a modern temple and of recent construction. Still worth a visit. Beautiful.

Name: Jayesh Chandra ... P
Title: * Lakshmi's
Review: It is a small temple tucked away beside the Elliots beach.  There is a parking spot beside the temple on a narrow road.  You enter the temple and there are barricades guiding you around the 8 Lakshmi's, eight forms of wealth, namely, offspring, success, prosperity, wealth, courage, bravery, food, and knowledge..  You start with Lakshmi and Vishnu.  Then you go to Santhanalakshmi, Vijayalakshmi, Vidyalakshmi and Gajalakshmi.  The top floor DhanaLakshmi is rumoured to act like a lighthouse. Then Aadilakshmi, Dhaanya lakshmi and Dharyalakshmi.   See the gold plating on the top.

Name: KARTHIKb87
Title: Ashtalakshmi temple in chennai
Review: Its Ashtalakshmi temple in chennai which is mooted by Kanchi Chandrasekrandra swamigal (Sankaracharya) on lines on Mumbai MahaLakshmi temple. Temple is located in Besant nagar beach seashore. Temple had separate 8 lakshmi  Sannithi's (sanctum santorum) Its must visit temple in Chennai and lot of people throng here on festival days.

Name: TravellingSands
Title: Temple of Eight Forms of Gooddess Lakshmi
Review: This temple is dedicated to the eight forms of Goddess Lakshmi who is the Goddess of wealth and consort of Lord Mahavishnu. The temple is located on the Southern End of Elliots(Besant Nagar) Beach and is one of the important temples in Chennai.

Name: Mrudula
Title: Elloit's temple
Review: This beach is located near Elloit's beach in besant nagar. which is a famous temple for it's architecture and the dieties are located at four levels

Name: HWPKG
Title: Excellent experience
Review: You climb about 20-30 steps to see this beautiful temple that is right on the beach in Chennai. We went on New Year's Day so there was a mela happening on the beach. Had really good darshan and a fantastic overall experience.

Name: ArpanPahm
Title: Good temple
Review: Ashtalakshmi Temple was very famous and beautiful temple. I am happy with stay. Environment was very peaceful. Good architecture.

Name: LostMySelfTraveling
Title: Must visit  temple in Chennai
Review: It is one of the most visited Hindu temple in Chennai. The temple is located in a sea shore in Besant Nagar. When you visit don't miss to visit the beach also. As the beach is not much crowded and peaceful. The temple has Ashta means eight Murthis of Goddess Lakshmi. You can also get the Kumkum. You can also put your money notes at the feet of goddess and collect along with Kumkum along packed in the note. And keep it in wallet or at your puja idol at home. So that you will have abundance. Overall its a great experience except the fish smell from the beach.

Name: Bhalaji N
Title: Spiritual at its best!!!
Review: Everyone will wonder what experience they will have when you walk through a corridor of fishermen huts and reach the temple. Surprise is the word i have for you.Temple will change the entire feeling you had before walking in. You dont feel or even remember when you step inside. The main temple is very good. Queues are long in evenings. Rest of the god temples are few climbs away. This temple visit will be fun for kids too. There is no other such temple in city, i can claim this confidently. Warning - Dont try the beach \ sand in front of the temple. On the soar side you have to walk back through the same corridor forgetting the temple memories

Name: Thiru71
Title: Blessings of 8 Lakshmis
Review: Temple needs renovation with paintings. The Bay of Bengal view from the terrace of the temple is excellent. Enough parking is there for Bus, car and 2 Wheelers. Shoes and Sandal are taken care in front of the temple. During sunny days it is very hot,early morning or evening visit to the temple is opt. Spend enough time and don't rush in while going round each Lakshmi sanadhis. Listen to the Iyer's instruction and poojas are done as per our request perfectly.

Name: iamsvs
Title: Seaside temple
Review: This temple is dedicated to Devi in her eight forms.  The temple is setup such that you are guided from one sannidhi to another through a maze of pathways.  Overall the temple is small compared to similar temples, but is fairly old.  THe maintenance is also nice and clean.

Name: Natarajan K
Title: Temple at seashore
Review: This Temple is located at Besant nagar beach. Which is a seashore Temple. We have to climb up in stairs to see asta Lakshmi and excellent sea view also.

Name: Bala Tripura S
Title: Beautiful temple on sea shore
Review: This temple is dedicated to Goddess Laxmi and is constructed on sea shore of Besant Nagar,Chennai.We need to walk a little inside from city bus stand to reach this temple.This is multistored building on which each floor we can see different form of Goddess like Adi Laxmi,Gaja Laxmi,Vijaya Laxmi,Dhana Laxmi,Dhanya Laxmi.Vidya Laxmi,Santana Laxmi and Dhairya Laxmi.We can see the different temples for Lord Hanuman,Vishnu etc in the premises.We can have the nice view of Bay of Bengal from this temple.

Name: cootmom
Title: Hot, crowded on the weekend but worthy of a visit
Review: The Temple of the Eight Lakshmis is at the lovely Chennai beach but it is very, very crowded here and difficult to find parking at night. We only made it to one Lakshmi and then headed to the beach. Would love to see it in daylight.

Name: Ananth 727499
Title: Divine, calm place in the sea shore..
Review: This temple is constructed in the year of 1976.This is the place where you could see all the  eight forms of Goddess Mahalakshmi.. This is one of the two Ashtalakshmi temples in India, the other one temple is inHyderabad ..Goddess Lakshmi is the deity who grants the Ashtama Siddhis and Ashta Iswaryam. Both Mahavishnu and Mahalakshmi (with Her eight forms) reside in this Ashtalakshmi Temple. It is a gift for us have darshan in this Temple.. According to Puranas, Goddess Mahalakshmi is said to have emerged from The churning of milk ocean.. So,  it is exactly a god's gift to have a temple constructed and for the people to have Darshan on the shores facing the sea for Goddess Lakshmi whose birthplace is the sea.Kindly Do visit this Temple without any reasons and get the blessings...

Name: Amij
Title: Mesmerizing
Review: What an experience we had, beautiful temple and wonderful learning experience about the religion and culture. Very nice.

Name: Corey E
Title: beautiful but beware
Review: The temples are definitely worth seeing however...beware of the so called "guides."  They act like they're giving you a spontaneous tour because they happen to be walking next to you and will begin to explain things.   We told our gentlemen that we were there to film and weren't really tourists.  He stood by us anyway every once in a while explaining what it was that was before us.   When we went to leave he asked for money.  $60USD.!!!!   That's more than a weeks wage for a bulk of the population.  Not gonna do it.

Name: Narayanan Ganesan
Title: lakshmi Maam Pahi
Review: Absolute divine place. The day I visited was Ugadi day, Andhra New Year and really crowded. The air the sound of waves and people chanting names and Slokhas have really made an impression.  This is a temple where u can see all Lakshmi Devi. All you need is Bhakthi and patience.  Fantastic place and one must visit. May you all blessed by Ashta Lakshmi.

Name: TapasyaKaulRajaram
Title: Beautiful temple next to the sea
Review: This is a beautiful temple, it has all the 8 devis housed in one temple. It is very scenic as it is close to the beach.

Name: Narendran J
Title: Lovely place with beautiful deities
Review: We went to this temple to celebrate my in-laws 40th wedding anniversary. Before you enter, you need to decide if you are going to offer any darshan or you are only going to pray and move on. This is because there are 2 separate queues and they are separated by metal bars to ensure no one crosses over and I guess also to ensure those who pay more gets ahead of the queue. The guy who was responsible for issuing receipts for the darshan helped us at the very first goddess, there are 8 goddesses in total and you would need to navigate them through narrow steps, but the view from each level is breathtaking. Definitely worth a visit but be informed that the priests will ask/cajole you to buy gold-plated coins or request you to place a rupee note at the foot of the deity and another rupee note for him to pack the bindi for you to bring it back home.

Name: varun v
Title: Goddess of Wealth
Review: Here Goddess Lakshmi is worshiped in 8 forms (Ashta meaning 8).A must visit temple,at Besant Nagar, Chennai.

Name: Puneetkumar Pattar
Title: Beautiful temple on the shore of Besant Nagar Chennai
Review: The Ashtalaksmi temple is located in Besant Nagar, right next to the sea. As the name indicates, it is dedicated to the eight primary forms of Goddess Lakshmi. It is a relatively new temple (~45 years). Being next to the sea makes it a serene location to visit.

Name: JANET S
Title: Excellent experience.
Review: You can feel ok visiting this place.  Inside is no hassle.  Very interesting architecture. Definite to put on your list.

Name: K V K
Title: Shore temple
Review: This temple is well maintained. But the idols are kept at various hieghts making it difficult for us to climb to have darshan. It is specifically difficult for old age people making them to skip darshan if a few shrines

Name: Harvey
Title: Wonderful experience
Review: I have been going to this temple on Fridays whenever I happen to be in Chennai. I try and stay for 24 minutes here. It is well worth visiting.

Name: priya gupta
Title: Beautiful temple on Marina Beach!!!
Review: There are 8 Devi darshan in a beautiful temple located on the Marina beach. You have to walk few steps up and down to see all. So u need to be able to walk. VIP darshan entry for Rs 20. The shringar of the Devi’s is beautiful!! Pandits have a bad habit of asking money everywhere.

Name: Sunil G
Title: Located by the beach
Review: Ashtalakshmi temple is very popular temple located by the beach. It was crowded the day we went, but it was well organized.

Name: Anusuya D
Title: Temple for ashtalakshmi
Review: This temple is located near besant nagar beach. This is the temple for ashtalakshmi. We have to climb the stairs to pray each goddess of lakshmi

Name: Manoj Kumar C V
Title: Ashtalekshmy temple
Review: This temple is in Basanth Nagat Chennai. Situated in Basanth nagar beach. The eight forms of lekshmi namely santhanalekshmy, vijayalekshmy, vidhyalekshmy, gajalekshmy, dhanalekshmy, adilekshmy, dhanyalekshmy, dairyalekshmy are in this temple. This is unique and must see for Hindus devotees.

Name: ekta s
Title: Temple with serene view of the ocean
Review: The temple is located very close to the beach hardly a min walk. Except festivals, the temple doesn't get huge crowd during afternoons and evenings so can be visited easily.Few good veg restaurants also available nearby. You can conduct any function or pooja with prior bookings.

Name: Mukta2016
Title: Beautiful Temple
Review: The Ashtalaxmi Temple is one of the few temples dedicated to the eight forms of Goddess Laxmi. We had been here in the evening and had good darshan. The temple is located close to the sea and one can have a good view of the beach and the sea from the temple's first floor.

Name: plpalani
Title: Various Lakshmi Avatar at one place
Review: This temple is on the beach... in fact one of the Lakshmi is facing the sea and good breeze.Santhana Lakshmi, thairiya Lakshmi, Gajan Lakshmi, DhanaLakshmi, Dhanya Lakshmi, Vidhya Lakshmi are some of the eight Lakshmi idols here. But one has climb up and down on very very narrow steps.There is Lord Hanuman near the enterence

Name: gowtham t
Title: Devotional
Review: The temple is quite holy and you will be able to see different types of goddess lakshmi and it is very silebt!

Name: HappySheep
Title: Bling
Review: Full on riot of colour and sometimes active with ceremonies, this beachside temple is worth visit and makes for great photos

Name: Priyanka S
Title: Temple on the beach
Review: It's a nice temple but one has to climb thru very narrow staircase...too congested..different avatars of Lakshmi goddess

Name: raghusai26
Title: Serene
Review: The temple with Rich history is  serene and filled with divine vibration. The temple hosts shrine for 8 forms of Lakshmi. The special entry ticket of RS.20/- will help to bear the Que only for short distance after which both lines merge. Elders should note that they need to climb to floors to see all shrines.There are other shrines to in the temple complex. The temple also Provide breath taking view of besant nagar beach

Name: nageswararao g
Title: Located by the beach
Review: Very popular temple for chennai tourists. Located by the beach. Its a must visit for Hindu devotees who come to beach area.

Name: BPSingh2000
Title: Old Powerful place
Review: It is situated close to Besant Nagar beach. Temple is unique in itself. Eight form of Goddess is there where you have to move in the complex from one Goddess to another. Very good and powerful Deity. Must Visit place. After visiting temple, one can also enjoy the Beasant Nagar beach which is closeby

Name: Lax
Title: Wonderful & Unique Temple
Review: Though approach is a bit difficult, you won't be lost if follow sign boards. It is close to shoreline. The layout is unique; don't miss the view of Bay of Bengal from First floor; most of the priests are kind and helpful. At the sight of main deity, divine couple one will be so much immersed in Bakthi. It is difficult to take our eyes off them. We visit frequently since we live nearby. Evening hours crowded.

Name: ank4228
Title: 8 forms of Goddess Lakshmi worshipped here
Review: It is the Mahalakshmi temple situated in Basant Nagar, Adyar region in Chennai. The temple is near the Eliott Beach.Though there's a special ticket to skip the line (Rs 20-25) but do not buy as the crowd would be nearYou can worship 8 different forms of Goddess Lakshmi here. 1st you worship the big idol and thereafter moving on the first floor to view the rest. One can view the pristine Elliott Beach from 1st floor. Try to spend some time although the heat would not allow you to stand for more than 1 minute.

Name: vinodkhedkar
Title: Goddess Lakshmi
Review: This is a nice temple dedicated to Goddess Lakshmi and located at Besant Nagar beach in Chennai. Ashtalakshmi means eight forms of Goddess Lakshmi. Very religious ambiance.

Name: Sunil G
Title: Famous temple
Review: Famous temple located next to Besant nagar beach. Very popular with tourists and localalites for darshan of Goddess.

Name: SachuChachu
Title: Temple constructed very close to Besant nagar beach
Review: Eight avatars of Goddess Lakshmi can be seen in Ashtalakshmi temple.Very approachable, avoid LB road route. You can try beach road or kalashetra route to avoid city traffic. Evening would be awesome. Don't go for paid dharshan as the free dharshan and paid dharshan are almost of the same pace.

Name: Prasad B
Title: Holy shrine with an architectural masterstroke !!
Review: Place although is located at Sea Shore, but constructed with due diligence and care to keep holiness in mind; which is why it looks like an architectural marvel.Requested herewith to go in the evening time.

Name: vasan224
Title: a temple in a sea shore
Review: it is one of the temple which locating in the sea shore, a nice place to visit and worship, recently a kumbhabishekam were also done for this temple, a nice place to visit with family.

Name: Sreekanth M
Title: Ashtalakshmi Temple Chennai
Review: Very nice and Large temple. To have all 8 Ammas darshan it requires lot of walk. Go in the early morning or late evening during summer.

Name: tyag_1984
Title: Clean and peaceful environment
Review: Maintained well and clean temple. must visit place for pilgrims visiting chennai. friendly atmosphere ans ideal place for meditation

Name: authorneelesh
Title: view of the sea
Review: a two store temple or relatively recent origin which as eight avatars of Maa and you go to each one in a sequence.The view of the beach from the second storey is awesome.Is much revered locally.

Name: GOPIKA J
Title: beautiful temple
Review: It is a temple facing the beach..beautifully constructed..includes different forms of godess mahalakshmi..was a peaceful experience

Name: spicyyy27
Title: Beautiful
Review: The place where Mother Lakshmi resides.Was very nice seeing the different forms of Goddess LAkshmi and the Guru's were quite friendly.WEnt to the Amman Temple across and she is just beautiful and the long walk on the beach is more amazing

Name: Ashish D
Title: Another landmark in Besant Nagar !
Review: This temple has stood the test of wind and tide of the sand and sea over the years, including the tsunami !

Name: 13arvinds
Title: Lakshmi temple next to Besantnagar beach
Review: Relatively new temple, just off the southern end of the Besantnagar beach with a number of shrines devoted to Lakshmi along with a few other shrines to other deities (one of Lakshmi along with Vishnu, one for Ganapati, one for Hanuman ...).The design of the temple is rather different with several of the Lakshmi shrines arranged in a spiral fashion. The approach is for most part via a narrow staircase with sharp (right) angles more or less along the sides (internal and external!), and it is so narrow that only one reasonably well-built person can fit between the walls in many places; so, there was a long line in (mostly) single file slowly proceeding through. (For some reason, there was a huge crowd on the day we visited; several busloads of pilgrims were also there at the same time.)Anyway, the design of the structure reminded us of a small fort!The location on the sea shore doubtless also contributes to the degradation of the structure. (I assume that the sea breeze is a significant factor to the paint wearing off and other minor damage to the carvings on the temple.)  But I wish it was maintained in better condition. Also, some of the shrines were not opened at the time we visited (don't know why).

Name: anandnh
Title: Temple visit
Review: You can see all 8 forms of Lakshmi in one temple. The steps to the each Lakshmi is steep and narrow stair case.You’ll feel blessed and amazed at the location of the place.

Name: RajeevP304
Title: Unique temple
Review: The temple has multiple levels with eight different idols of the Goddess. It is located very close to the ocean and has a very serene ambiance. Strongly recommended for those on a religious tour.

Name: Samuel
Title: Must see place
Review: I have visited this temple recently which is located just near the besant nagar beach.There are totally eight Lakshmi goddess.we worship all those by climbing through steps. Also we have a chance to see the beach view from top of the temple.So it's a must see place in Chennai. Definitely l u will enjoy.

Name: akhilchandu
Title: Nice temple
Review: Sri Ashtalakshmi Temple was established in Besant Nagar, Chennai on the coast of Bay of Bengal as per the desire of Sri Maha Periyaval of Kanchi Mutt, Sri Chandrasekara Saraswati Swamigal. The temple is huge with length and breadth of nearly 65ft and 45ft respectively. Six prayers (pujas) take place each day as per the Vedic rules followed by the temple. Many devotees put their faith in the foundation of this temple. Apart from locals, you can also witness tourists flocking in from different parts of the world to enjoy the beauty of the temple by the Besant Nagar Beach. The foundation of the Ashtalakshmi Temple was laid down by its followers in the year 1974. This was followed by the sanctification ceremony which was held on 5th April 1976. You can also be a part of the numerous festivals celebrated in the temple, some of which are Navaratri, Pavitra Ursavam, Markazhi month, Gokulastami, Deepawali, Kartigai, New Year (1st January), Pongal and May Day. Along with this temple, Mahalakshmi temple in Mumbai is the only other temple of the Goddess which is situated on the Indian coast. The grandiosity of the place can be estimated from the fact that nearly 7 million were spent in renovating the temple.

Name: Abhishek
Title: Must Visit
Review: This temple overlooks the Beach, seek your blessings from goddess of wealth, knowledge. Ideal time to visit during evening when the weather is bit cool.

Name: GrannyMaa
Title: Divine place
Review: As the name connotes - this temple is dedicated to worship of Goddess Lakshmi in 8 different avatars. It is very old temple, located on sea shore of Besant Nagar Beach.

Name: Dev
Title: A must visit temple with a nice breeze from the sea
Review: A must visit temple except for the elderly who can't claim the narrowed and high elevated steps. You see all 8 Lakshmi goddess idols.

Name: Balasubramanian R
Title: Ashtalakshmi temple chennai
Review: Ashtalakshmi temple is situated on the sea shore of Bay of Bengal. Eight types of Lakshmi deities are there in the temple. 3 in the ground, 4 in level one and one in second level. At the entrance Lord Vishnu and Lakshmi deities are there.

Name: kkarthikeyan2105
Title: visit to Ashtalakshmi temple
Review: It is in the vicinity to the beasant nagar beach .visited on 1st oct at 17.30 hrs . not so crowded though was sunday . if you take special darshan at rs 20 , you would have a wait time of  10-15 min .The different forms of the god lakshmi are located in an ascending levels and narrow staircases leading to the same .outside you have other dieties at the ground level it is a divine experience & worth a visit in chennai .the crowd is well managed and persons in a lot of 20-30 are allowed once with time delay before  the next lot ..

Name: dinesh_j84
Title: 'One of the famous Temples in Chennai'
Review: This is one of the famous and oldest temples in Chennai. It is located close to the Besant Nagar Beach. The temple is a main place of attraction. One day tour packages in Chennai have Ashtalakshmi Temple in their itinerary. The deity is believed to be powerful.

Name: jjramanairforce
Title: Temple  built in a new method
Review: Hindu God for wealth  Mahalakshmi.   Here we can dharsan all  the eight Lakshmi ( Astta LakshmI )  in one place.  This temple is built in a new method. You have to   climb  few steps to dharsan each deity, A  good  location on the Marina beach. People come here with a recreation mood with children.

Name: Gaurang S
Title: Ashtalakshmi temple
Review: All forms of Lakshmi in this temple located at sea shore. We visited this temple on Friday and there was no rush and easily climb steps and Darshan each Maa Laxmi temple. No need to purchase Rs 20/- ticket. Mobile/Camera allowed. Back side is Besent beach; worth to visit it.

Name: tnbalaji90
Title: Nice Temple..!
Review: It is a temple dedicated to Goddess Lakshmi and her eight forms. Each deity here is very beautifully adorned and makes us feel blessed. Situated in a picturesque location, this temple is constructed in a different style than most other South Indian temples.

Name: Venkata Shivaku... R
Title: Understand Ashtalakshmi first and then visit
Review: It is a unique temple in Chennai in the sense that all the eight Lakshmis are housed at the same place; Fridays and weekends are terribly crowded so if you need a relaxed visit to this site, avoid these three days; Before visiting this temple, read about the functionalities of each of the Ashtalakshmis and then go. The experience will be very different; I found Tuesday particularly good for visiting this temple; If you are booking an archana for self or family do so for all the eight deities and not just for Dhanalakshmi (which many people do);Be careful about the steps and if young children are accompanying you, avoid crowded times at all costs;If possible, sit quietly somewhere in the premises and chant Lakshmi gayathri mantra or Shree Sooktham; very effective.

Name: anandnh
Title: Ashtalakshmi blessings
Review: Very unique and divine experience to visit all forms of Lakshmi in a unique temple where you have to climb steps and visit each laxmi temple. Enjoy the beach if you want after that.

Name: Gugan_Ilango
Title: Beautiful temple on beach road
Review: Ashtalakshmi Temple is a beautiful temple located on the beach road. and you see the temple architecture of tamil nadu

Name: Ravi M
Title: Good
Review: Its very beautiful temple in chennai. Its located in near besant nagar  beach. Don't miss this place in chennai visit.

Name: Kaliraj T
Title: Peaceful place
Review: The temple is in seashore and very well maintained. No rush on mornings. Visited the place on Thursday morning.

Name: Nitin M
Title: As a Tourist with family is nice place to see.
Review: 1. A good Devotional place with old history.2. A good view from top of the Temple. 3. Need more Cleanliness.

Name: Seema519
Title: The Lakshmi Temple
Review: The ashtalakshmi temple is near the Elliot's beach.Unique experience,Climbing stairs to pray to all 8 deities,once you reach the top, beautiful view of the sea beach,city and the temple

Name: Manickavasagam T
Title: Good place for tourist
Review: Good place for tourist outside Chennai. Need to maintain the temple little bit clean. There are 9 lord Lakshmi .  Only Main Lakshmi Narasimhar was decorated with Pushpam and idols. All other Lakshmis  - No Malai . no maintanace why ?

Name: Hoosierlad
Title: Visit all the historic and other religious sites in Chennai
Review: We visited a few temple sites, both historic and in use. The architecture and the people are wonderful. Take the time to smile, and say hi and the people will respond ....we felt like celebs with people wanting to meet us and take pics with us. Wonderful people.

Name: AKTHAKUR
Title: Excellent temple by the sea to enjoy the architecture
Review: This temple has eight forms of Goddess Lakshmi consort of Lord Vishnu as wella s Goddess of Wealth.It is a must visit if you go to Chennai.There are shops around the temple to buy offerings.Avoid holidays sundays as it can be extremely crowded.It is better to take a auto rickshaw or car.You can donate in the hundi as per your capacity.you can take a guide from the shop if you wish so that you can see the whole temple easily and understand the religious significance of the temple.

Name: WayfarerIndia
Title: Unique temple in a unique location
Review: Though she is the goddess of wealth, Laxmi doesn't have too many temples devoted to her. Here is one in which she is depicted in 8 forms, hence the name.Situated bang on the beach adds even more to its uniqueness

Name: Iratdog
Title: Beauty by the sea
Review: I was here just recently. It's quite a sight. Right on the beach. As is the case with most Hindu shrines it's hard to get a good picture. Absolutely impressive. One detail I don't like is the constant pestering for money. This was the most bothersome to date. Even the shoe keeper was pushy. As soon as I entered the site a "guide" attached himself to me. He wasn't particularly helpful, but he was nice enough. I learned more about the eight forms of the goddess from reading than this guy could give me. Usually it's the other way around. The downside of this experience is that they planked the whole place over, so the lines of sight are basically obliterated. You get the added value of walking next to everything. You lose any hope of appreciating the actual as built conditions. Here's a tip, go in with 5 rupee coins. Lots of them...Hope you enjoy it. It's not to be missed.

Name: AnjaliVayeda
Title: Excellent temple by the sea
Review: Very peaceful, very well constructed. You can plan to visit this temple if you are fond of pilgrimages.

Name: Shankar1206
Title: Ashtalakshmi Temple
Review: One of the rare temple, where all the eight forms of Goddess Lakshmi has temple built. The temple is located near the sea shore at Besant Nagar. A must visit for those spiritullay inclined.

Name: Bhuvana S
Title: Temple by the sea
Review: Ashtalkashmi temple being one of the popular spots in Chennai has been on my bucket list, so visited this temple recently to clear my bucket list and also to get the blessings of the 8 Lakshmi's  (ashta means 8 and Lakshmi is the Goddess of wealth in the Hindu religion) .We went around 530 in the evening and the sea breeze really made it a wonderful experience. Walking around the ground floor, we started with the Lakshmi Narayana ( goddess lakshmi and her husband Narayana) and then we climbed up the stairs to see Gajalakshmi, Santhana Lakshmi,Vijayalakashmi, vidyalakshmi, and climbed up one more floor to see Dhanlakshmi, and came down to see the remaining 3 lakshmi's who are on the ground floor - Adi lakshmi, dhanya lakshmi and veeralakshmi. They also have separate small temples for Ganesha, Guruvayurappan, hanuman and chakrathazhvar. This temple is not accessible friendly at all and anybody who has a Knee issue will definitely have trouble climbing the stairs up and down as the stairs were small and narrow as well. Definitely not suitable for old people at all.

Name: Anand G
Title: Unique and interesting
Review: It is not every place you find a temple dedicated Goddess Lakshmi. This is still more interesting that it has the eight forms of the Goddess. Although located in a questionable area, the inside is as clean and neat as any temple can be. A must visit if you are a temple fancier. The sculpture on the tower (Gopuram) is typical Tamil style and quite ornate.

Name: pacchhu
Title: If you are fond of gods, only then
Review: This is certainly one of the locations, that specifically devotes the temple to goddess Lakshmi ( and all avatar's associated ).I have been to this temple multiple times, but during this visit in Dec, 2016, the major portion of the temple was closed for renovation ( Dhanurmasa ) and hence, was bit of a lop sided visit with my wife.

Name: iSkylark
Title: Temple by the sea
Review: It wasn't until I reached the top of the temple that I realized its proximity to the ocean and was taken by the breeze. This was my first visit to a temple in this area of the country and served as my introduction to this type of architecture. If you are a Westerner not accustomed to the rituals or customs involved in visiting temples, please note you will have to leave your shoes outside and should dress modestly. If it is a hot day, it will be hard on your feet so try to go early in the morning, if possible.

Name: krazikams
Title: Goddess Laxmiji temple
Review: Located in Besant Nagar, this temple has 8 forms of Goddess Laxmi and is popular with tourists and locals. During festive season, it gets heavily crowded and people buy token/tickets for entry. It is adjacent to Besant Nagar beach.

Name: B S
Title: Best Temple
Review: Nice temple, with pleasant air. nicely constructed. very good behavior  by the temple staff. Yummy Taste Prasad.

Name: ketancparekh
Title: pilgrimage
Review: i have been to this temple many times, the name itself says lakshmi and all the human being requiers the same, but the beauty is here u have vidhya lakshmi for studying children etc so eight diffrent lakshmi for various needs in life,

Name: jiyer2016
Title: Revival of childhood
Review: Each time I visit India, particularly Chennai - I make it a point to visit to visit this utterly charming, breathtaking temple nestled along the shores of Besant Nagar beach. I try to remember the eight beautifully adorned Lakshmi's and enjoy the beach breeze that sweeps through the open terraces near the sannadi of Dhana Lakshmi. This temple is a must see for its beautiful architecture coupled with its beautiful location.

Name: KrishnaBalaram
Title: Taking darshan of mahalakshmi
Review: My evaluation of 4 out of 5 for this site mostly has to do with my poor planning and less to do with the temple itself. As with many mandirs in South India, darshan is closed during afternoon hours. I discovered it's closure only after buying pushpam offerings so was walking around a bunch of closed altar spaces with a box of flowers. Sensing my frustration with not being able to make my offerings, a prabhu compassionately took me around to all but the main Lakshmi-Narayan installation so I could make my offerings. With that being said...It is a beautiful temple, the people are very, very friendly.  So many beautiful manifestations of mahalakshmi! And on the roof level there is a nice Ocean view above Elliot's beach. We also took Prasadam with the locals and had an otherwise lovely time. Would love to revisit during darshan hours.

Name: Shrinagesh M
Title: Beautiful architecture
Review: This is a vertical temple and you need to climb many stairs. The many forms of Goddess Mahalakshmi are divinely displayed.Located on the beach...

Name: Bharani K
Title: great temple to visit
Review: Very impressed on the temple,  people had to visit and know the history.  It would be advisable to have more history of the temple in either writings or video for people to learn.  Priest were very friendly.   Tamil Nadu government need to spend time/effort to clean the nearby area to preserve the history.

Name: Rucha121
Title: Temple near Sea-Shore in Besant Nagar
Review: Goodess Laxmiji temple in besant Nagar very close to Sea Shore. Hugely popular among locals and crowded with tourists on weekends. Pretty old temple, narrow fleet of stairs to go to higher levels. 8 different forms of Goddess Laxmi are seen here. Enjoy the divine blessings and temple prasadam.

Name: Narayanan S
Title: Seek Blessings from Goddess
Review: In the seventies the temple used to be known for its tranquillity facing the sea. It is a great temple housing goddess Lakshmi in all her eight forms and also as the consort for Lord Vishnu. There are sannidhis for Anjaneya, Chakrathalwar, Guruvayoorappan, Dasavathara ...It is maintained well and the archakas perform their job well.It is a temple I frequently visit to prayDo not go there on Sundays as the tourist crowd will be heavy.

Name: vamsikrishha9
Title: Temple with a surprising element
Review: If you are not a local of chennai, this is a must visiting place. You will get to climb to the top which will give you a very good view of the beach.

Name: Srinivas S
Title: Famous temple
Review: We went during auspicious days after postponing for many days. They close and won't allow you to climb up and visit amman if you go late, after 8pm

Name: Ra_Radha
Title: Combo of Temple + Beach
Review: Located in Besant Nagar, this temple of Goddess Lakshmi is very famous and attracts lot of tourists. Beware of priests, they insist on offering money everywhere. Better offer your offerings in Hundi and not in Arti thali, as that money goes in pockets of priests directly. 8 avtars of goddess Lakshmi is here and after you done with temple, you can visit the beach adjoining the temple. beach is not clean and full of dead fish and thorns, walk carefully in dark.

Name: Anurag243
Title: Spitirual place
Review: Asthalaxmi temple is temple of godess laxmi.. 8 different roop of laxmi ji is there... lots of attraction and rush.. very closer to the beach and tha view from tenple of beach is also awesome....
